intro: Meladerma puberulum, commonly known as the velvetleaf meladerma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Meladerma puberulum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
